Herpetology-Short Course Announcement

Jun 26, 2017

An Autonomous Certificate Course

Jointly Organized by
Department of Zoology,
MESâ€™ Abasaheb Garware College, Pune.
 and
Institute of Natural History Education and Research,
(INHER) Pune

Certificate Course in Herpetology

A wonderful opportunity to know our reptiles and amphibians. This short course covers variety of topics by eminent experts in this field.

Key Information

3 - 17 July 2017

Abasaheb Garware College,

Deccan Gymkhana, Karve Road, Pune.


Talks: 6:30 - 8:30pm

Field Trips on weekends.


Faculty

Dr. Hemant GhateDr. Anand Padhye
Dr. Varad Giri Ashok Captain
Shauri Sulakhe Amit Sayyed
Anil Khaire Ram Bhutkar
Nikhil Dandekar Makarand Ketkar

Eligibility

  • 10th standard in any faculty is eligible to join this course.
  • The course shall be conducted in English language.
  • Students and interested people from all backgrounds are welcome.

Syllabus

  • Evolution of reptiles and amphibians
  • Taxonomy and identification
  • Diversity and biology
  • Conservation of herpetofauna
  • Venomous and non-venomous snakes
  • Snake bites and first-aid
  • Photography

Registration

Fees Rs 3500

Payable at: Non Grant Office, Garware College, Karve Road (between 11am-1:30pm).


Contact

Dr. Anand Padhye - 9922558271

Garware College, Non-grant Office - 020-41038208

INHER

Institute of Natural History Education and Research promotes scientific knowledge in natural history through research.
